result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herbert Paulniz C Rogers-Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Herbert Paulniz C Rogers-Williams in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Herbert Paulniz C Rogers-Williams.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-8-2022, filed.  rmm

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Herbert Paulniz C Rogers-Williams not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. has received discovery and would like a status date to review with defendant.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with  Andrew B.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving at all.

HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Herbert Paulniz C Rogers-Williams in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Herbert Paulniz C Rogers-Williams in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
